app.cards

Enum Suit

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Enum<Suit>
      • app.cards.Suit
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Comparable<Suit>

    public enum Suit
extends java.lang.Enum<Suit>
    Lists all possible card suits and stores their human-readable names as well as an integer value to enable comparisons. Values start at 1 (Clubs) and go up to 4 (Spades).

        for (Suit c : Suit.values())

        public static Suit valueOf(java.lang.String name)

      • getName

        public java.lang.String getName()
        Get the full name of the suit
        Returns:
        Full name of the suit (e. g. "Clubs", "Diamonds", "Hearts" or "Spades")

      • getShortName

        public char getShortName()
        Get the abbreviation character of the suit
        Returns:
        Abbreviation character of the suit (e. g. 'C', 'D', 'H' or 'S')

      • getValue

        public int getValue()
        Get the numeric value of the suit
        Returns:
        Numeric value of the suit, from 1 (Clubs) up to 4 (Spades)

      • fromShortcut

        public static Suit fromShortcut(char shortcut)
        Returns the appropriate Suit for the supplied shortcut, which is matched against the shortName property of the Suit objects.
        Parameters:
        shortcut - short name for which the Suit should be looked up (case-insensitive). Must be one of 'C' (Clubs), 'D' (Diamonds), 'H' (Hearts) or 'S' (Spades).
        Returns:
        Suit object with matching shortName, or null for an invalid shortcut
